text: [Music]
hi guys it's Elise from ICONic addiction
on today's episode we're gonna be making
these gorgeous little chop tip Oreos
with sprinkle tops chalk dipped Oreos
will look really simple but when you
actually start making them there's a few
tricks to getting them really nice and
perfectly smooth which I'm gonna show
you today let's get started you can use
any chocolate you like here but what its
gonna be your most forgiving color I've
got a pair of scissors now I'm using an
Oreo Malph I love the Oreo molds because
they give you a really nice shiny finish
but you can also use just the bottom
half of the cups in a regular cupcake
tray if you don't have an Oreo mold I've
got a few different assorted sprinkles
all different colors of shapes and sizes
and of course I've got some Oreos the
first thing that you want to do is you
want to just put a nice just a thin
coating of sprinkles in the bottom of
each of your little Oreo molds and just
flatten the matter you really just sort
of want like one layer of each of the
different types of sprinkles but you do
want it covering the entirety of the
Oreo mold alright just give that tray a
little just a little tap a little shake
just to make sure that all of your
little sprinkles are as even as they can
be now you want to pull some of that
white chocolate into your ziplock bag
and we're gonna cut off a very very thin
or small corner of fashion into a little
bit of a makeshift piping bag and then
you just want to just very very lightly
just drizzle it over top of those
sprinkles what we're trying to do is
create a really thin sprinkle covered
disc without messing up our sprinkles
too much and without going up too high
if you come up too high in your Oreo pan
you're not actually going to have enough
room to put in your Oreo cookie so I'm
kind of just putting it around in a nice
swirl and this just stops me from
messing up my sprinkles and getting
white chocolate on the other side of the
sprinkles but I really just want
sprinkles to be seen alright so take
those now and you want to pop them off
into either the fridge or the freezer
until those little top discs have
completely set now what you want to do
here is you just want to take a tiny
tiny little dollop of chocolate not too
tiny about half a teaspoon stick it onto
that little flat disc and then take an
Oreo straight away and squish it down
the important thing here is your Oreos
do need to be within the
line of your Oreo mold if they're
sticking up out over the top you're not
going to get that nice flat bottom on
your Oreos now for this part you can
either use your spoon or you can use
another ziplock bag I'm going to go with
another ziplock bag because it's just
gonna help me force the chocolate down
into those sides so I'm just gonna put
the remainder of my white chocolate into
the ziplock bag and snip off another
nice little tip now I'm just gonna force
that chocolate all the way down the
sides give your mold a couple of taps on
the bench and then you just want to come
around and just cover off on the tops
once again try not to overfill your Oreo
molds here all right now give it another
couple of good taps on the bench just to
even out that top coat and then pop that
back off into the fridge or freezer to
completely set so coming back to the
fridge or the freezer wherever you've
decided to set your little Oreos they
should pop out really really easily so
you may need to just brush some
additional sprinkles off the top and
what you've got there are some really
gorgeous little Oreo cookies coated with
your assortment of sprinkles I
absolutely love this idea I think it's
so versatile you could theme these up
with Christmas colored sprinkles you
could make them for Easter you could
make them for Valentine's Day so many
different ways that you can change these
Oreos up looks really really fresh on
the outside and on the inside it's just
a simple old Oreo cookie hope you've
enjoyed this tutorial make sure you
subscribe to my cupcake addiction for
three times weekly uploads and as always
thanks very much for watching
